result.execSummary:
The defendant Preston Richard Harvey Meyer was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. One or more other charges in this case were dismissed. The dismissed charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Preston Richard Harvey Meyer is presumed innocent of the dismissed charges.

  • Preston Richard Harvey Meyer was found guilty of Possession of THC (2nd+ Offense) [Modifiers: Repeater], a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(e).
  • Preston Richard Harvey Meyer was found guilty of Possession of Controlled Substance [Modifiers: Repeater], an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(b).
  • Preston Richard Harvey Meyer was found guilty of Possess Drug Paraphernalia [Modifiers: Repeater], an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 961.573(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

superMiscConds.notes:
If Probation is revoked and sent to jail or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due. All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt.
If revoked and sent to prison, DOC shall withhold 25% of all inmates monies to pay fines/costs with the balance due as a condition of extended supervision/parole.

Not to consume alcoholic beverages, illegal drugs or possess drug paraphernalia. 
Not possess controlled substances except for those medications specifically prescribed for him/her by a health care professional. 
Not to possess needles/syringes except with a valid prescription. 
Not associate with those who possess illegal controlled substances.

Counseling/assessments/treatment deemed appropriate by agent. AODA assessment/follow thru.
Provide DNA sample and be responsible for the cost.

records.descr: Notice and acknowledge of def voting ineligibility

records.addlTxt: of Right to Seek Post Conviction Relief

11:14 AM Prosecuting attorney Rebecca Meyer appeared by phone for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Preston Richard Harvey Meyer appeared by phone, in custody.  Attorney Steven Daniel Johnson appeared by phone for Preston Richard Harvey Meyer. No victim's rights issue, court calls case early.  Defendant waives right to in person appearance for the hearing today. State puts the offer on the record. Court does plea colloquy w/defendant. Defendant enters NC plea to counts 2, 3 and 4. Count 1 is dismissed. Court finds defendant guilty of counts 2, 3 and 4 and dismisses count 1. Court sentences deft to 2yrs in the State prison system on count 2 and imposes and stays a 2 yr prison sentence on counts 3 and 4 but stays them in favor of 2 years probation.
